activities.loc: Br I Courtroom, 3rd Fl, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randall G. Buckingham

records.addlTxt:
11:32 AM Defendant Randall G. Buckingham in court. Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre appeared by video for Randall G. Buckingham. Attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CM81 & 22CF213. 22CF213 still needs counsel appointed. Court directs Defendant to contact PD's office on felony case. Defendant states he went to PD's office and they are searching for counsel. Bail continued. adj. 11:36 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:03 PM Defendant Randall G. Buckingham in court. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Christian St. Pierre appearing by video. St. Pierre is representing on 22CM81 not appointed on this case. Cases will be set together. St. Pierre will not be appointed on this case. Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek in court - PD's office is searching for counsel. Schiek states there is no victim in felony case. Defendant states address & phone number. Bond continued. adj. 03:08 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 11:30 am.

3:07 PM Defendant Randall G. Buckingham in court. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court states has represented Defendant in the past. Defendant would like Judge Burns to continue with case. Schiek has no objection. Defendant states will be contacting PD's office. Bond continued. adj. 03:09 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:18 PM Court Commissioner Alexandra Francois appearing by video. Defendant Randall G. Buckingham appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Court questions Defendant on mailing address/phone number. Schiek statement to bail. Court sets bond. Case may possibly transferred to Branch II - Defendant will be notified if it is. adj. 01:21 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
